author: Special Correspondent
text:
The organs of G. Baskaran (60), an LIC advisor of Pulithikudi in Nagapattinam district, who was declared brain dead after meeting with an accident, have been donated to give a fresh lease of life to needy persons.

He met with an accident on Monday near the fish market at Kumbakonam and admitted to a Government hospital and then to Vinodaghan hospital in Thanjavur, where he was operated upon for head injury. Baskaran was subsequently declared brain dead on Tuesday evening.

Following this, his son Venkatesh and his daughter came forward to donate Baskaran’s organs and shifted him to the Cethar hospital in Tiruchi, where his vital organs were harvested by a team of doctors on Wednesday.

While his liver was used for a patient, who required a cadaveric transplant at Cethar hospital, the kidneys were sent to Meenakshmi Mission hospital in Madurai and Kauvery hospital in Tiruchi. Similarly, both eyes were sent to AG Eye hospital in Tiruchi.

A press release said that the harvested organs were sent to the needed hospitals based on allotment as per the Tamil Nadu Organ Network Sharing Waiting List.
title: New lease of life for four persons
